alert.note: Alert for Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 23 at 2:46PM EDT until further notice by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in North Carolina... Green Mill Run At Green Mill Run in Greenville affecting Pitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This exceeds the flood of record. * WHERE...Green Mill Run in Greenville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Travel around the ECU campus becomes increasinly difficult with several main roads likely closed. Charles Boulevard is likely impassable near the stream, as well as the end of Ficklen Drive. Water may also cover portions of Evans Road and 14th street. Some structures along 10th Street are threatened. Water also reaches portions of the neaby Lower Minges parking lot, and the ECU College Hill parking lot is inundated by several feet of water. At 11.0 feet, Any travel across the stream on the southeast side of Greenville is likely impossible as at least several feet of water inundates roads near crossings. Numerous homes and businesses adjacent to the stream are likely surrounded by water, with some structures inundated by a few feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.7 feet. - N/A - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EDT Saturday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...Major Flooding is expected. - Flood stage is 7.8 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued this evening.Sunday morning at 600 AM EDT.
